title: MD
biography:
Executive Summary

Dr. Anand Prakash Dubey is a doyen of Indian Pediatrics, currently serving as the Director Professor and Head of the Department of Pediatrics at Maulana Azad Medical College (MAMC), one of country's premier medical institutions. With over three decades of experience, he is a leading authority on pediatric infectious diseases, particularly Dengue and nutritional disorders. He plays a pivotal role in shaping national health policies for child care in India.

Education and Training

Dr. Dubey completed his MBBS and MD in Pediatrics from the University of Delhi. His academic journey has been rooted in the government healthcare system, giving him unparalleled insight into the epidemiological challenges facing Indian children.

Professional Career

Dedicated to public service, Dr. Dubey has spent the majority of his career at Lok Nayak Hospital associated with MAMC. As the Head of Department, he oversees one of the busiest pediatric units in Asia. He is also a senior executive member of the Indian Academy of Pediatrics (IAP), where he has contributed to formulating guidelines on immunization and diarrheal disease management.

Key Contributions & Innovations

  • Dengue Management Protocols: Authored key national guidelines for the clinical management of Dengue Fever in children, significantly reducing mortality rates during outbreaks in North India.
  • Celiac Disease Awareness: Pioneered screening programs for Celiac disease in Delhi schools, revealing a higher-than-expected prevalence.
  • Medical Education: A celebrated teacher, he has guided over 100 postgraduate theses and is the author of several standard textbooks for pediatric undergraduates.

Legacy and Impact

Dr. A. P. Dubey is revered not just as a clinician but as an institution builder. His efforts have modernized the pediatric emergency services at MAMC, saving countless lives. He continues to be a vocal advocate for strengthening public healthcare infrastructure.
aiSummary: A. P. Dubey is a pediatrics specialist with an H-index of 118 at Maulana Azad Medical College (MAMC) (Director Professor & Head). Known for pioneered Dengue Clinical Management Protocol and impacted an estimated 100,000 lives. Has been published in Science, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Nature Communications. Based in New Delhi, Delhi, India.
